type: Electrical Work for an Automated Radiosonde Launching System at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station
short_summary: Electrical Work for an Automated Radiosonde Launching System at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station
description: The Contractor will be responsible for performing electrical work required to prepare for the installation of an Automated Radiosonde Launching System and an Automated Weather Station at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station in Inukjuak, Quebec.
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
### Electrical Work for the Automated Radiosonde Launching System at Inukjuak Upper Air Station

**Official Tender Details:** 
* Tender Title: Electrical Work for the Automated Radiosonde Launching System at Inukjuak Upper Air Station
* Reference Number: PW-22-01006409
* Amendment Number: 0
* Tender Closing Date: September 27, 2022, 2:00 PM EST
* Notice Type: Request for Proposal
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding

**Contract Details:** 
* Contract Amount: [Not specified]
* Contract Period: From award to October 31, 2022
* Security Requirements: None
* Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs): James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement under Section 28 and Section 29, and Northeastern Quebec Agreement.

**Eligibility Criteria:**
* The bidder must be a Canadian company.
* The bidder must be a certified electrical contractor.
* The bidder must have experience with installation and maintenance of Automated Radiosonde Launching Systems (ARLS).

**Tender Requirements:** 
* The contractor will be responsible for:
	+ Installation of an Automated Radiosonde Launching System (ARLS) at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station.
	+ Installation of an Automated Weather Station (AWS) at the Inukjuak Upper Air Station.
	+ Electrical work required to prepare for the installation of the ARLS and the AWS.
* The contractor must meet the requirements of the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs).

**Procurement Strategy:** 
* This procurement is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).
* If no beneficiary of the mentioned CLCAs bids on this requirement, and two or more Indigenous Businesses bid, the requirement will be set aside and awarded to the Indigenous bidder with the lowest evaluated price.

**Bidding Instructions:**
* Interested bidders must submit their bid documents to the Contracting Authority.
* Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
* Bidders should submit their bid in English or French.

**Contact Information:**
* Caitlin Andersen
* Contracting Officer
* Phone: 289-348-0283
* Email: caitlin.andersen@canada.ca
* Address: 867 Lakeshore Road, Burlington, ON L7S 1A1, Canada.

The rewritten entry presents the government tender
